TopicTitle: Recording video and audio on Linux

Articles.Content:
Greetings....

I'm running KSP on Debian and I'd like to record game sessions. I've tried a couple things like recordmydesktop, kazam, and istanbul, but they have problems recording the sound too.

What do other Linux blokes here use?
I too would love to know this, I don't play KSP on Linux right now, but I plan to in the future!
Cinelerra has screen capture. If you use KDE, kdenlive has screen capture. I believe you could set a virtual patch thing for audio using JACK, but I'm not sure.
If you are using a new nivida gpu, gtx 650 and above I think, you can use nivida shadow play. It works really well, and as an extremely low impact on game performance.
